channel.title: Creating a game engine?
channel.description: Hello, my friends and I have an idea for a game. I will be doing the work, they are there for mostly "funding" and "support" :P. Anyways, I am planning to create a new engine [I know it's a lot of work but I really want to], but having just started C++, I have nowhere to go/know not what to do. If anyone could help me out, it would be very much appreciated :) Thanks Justis PS No posts saying you can't do this you're gonna fail its not possible etc etc

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:14, topic:164686”][quote author=Exception link=topic=223559.msg1939423#msg1939423 date=1198048213]

not to be captain obvious but why not just program…
your don’t need a game engine, instead you could just code the game…
oh fk thats a game engine, isnt it? but srsly, if your good at cache editing, you could just take moparscape and transform it, prob take a year for 3d stuff and crap to work but you could get it to work…

Sorry, but no. Go back to mscp.
[/quote][/quote]
fricken hypercrit.[quote=“Exception, post:13, topic:164686”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=223559.msg1939131#msg1939131 date=1198041484]
not to be captain obvious but why not just program…
your don’t need a game engine, instead you could just code the game…
oh fk thats a game engine, isnt it? but srsly, if your good at cache editing, you could just take moparscape and transform it, prob take a year for 3d stuff and crap to work but you could get it to work…
[/quote]
Sorry, but no. Go back to mscp.[/quote]
and you fail so stfu.

edit: Look at my sig too.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Yes, I understand that [now :P] and am using Irrlicht, unfortunately the people who were supposed to be artists are either: A) Finding Excuses to not do anything B) Trying to push Multiverse on me. I might just do this alone as originally planned…
I’m learning C++, its seems pretty simple because I’m so used to java.
Thanks for all the help

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

You should probably start using an Open Source engine first, you can even make commercial games with most of them.
As Avalanche said, Irrlicht is a good one, and relatively easy to use. If you want one with better graphics, you could also go for Ogre3d or CrystalSpace. But have in mind that, for making a 3D game, basic C++ knowledge is not enough. You need to actually know, at least, all the main features of C++, and know how to use them effectively, and some programming experience and maths knowledge is also important.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Well I see creating an engine will be a buttload of work and will take time I do not have… in the mean time I might just use another engine til i get much better and have more free time, I’m considering baja at the moment.

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @sh_ft sh!ft
item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

[quote=“Exception, post:13, topic:164686”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=223559.msg1939131#msg1939131 date=1198041484]
not to be captain obvious but why not just program…
your don’t need a game engine, instead you could just code the game…
oh fk thats a game engine, isnt it? but srsly, if your good at cache editing, you could just take moparscape and transform it, prob take a year for 3d stuff and crap to work but you could get it to work…
[/quote]
Sorry, but no. Go back to mscp.[/quote]
The math is simple: SDL + OpenGL + An Object Wrapper + Design Team + CrapLoad of Money == Game

For the general public, there’s modding. See id Software’s open sourced quake engine for linux/windows… A modified quake source could be goldsource which is valve’s original release of half life… Or for the most to date engine, look up the Source engine from valve, it’s completely free, with the only constituent that your game has to be free.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Exception, post:10, topic:164686”][quote author=cooper link=topic=223559.msg1933462#msg1933462 date=1197787093]
Spark3d? I remember that from a while ago, I wanted to use it but I never got time… have the graphics gotten better? Last time I saw it they were moderately outdated, but still pretty good.
[/quote]
Er, what do you mean? I’ve only been working on it for a few months. It has support for multiple polygon models, with filled faces, as well as rotation and zoom.[/quote]
Oh, maybe I saw something else… was yours ever at sparkware.net?

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

writing a game engine has very little do to programming skills, it requires a hell of a lot of design and depending on the targeted game genre, maths/physics/audio/etc skills/understanding

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

cooper:

DirectX10 but we all know that probably won’t happen

Errm, may I ask why? DX10 is the same as DX9, they’re all backwards compatible, just have different requirements. An API is still an API, regardless of how much it is updated. Perhaps you are saying that because you don’t have a DX10 compatible GFX card?

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

It will be 3d, and I would really like to use DirectX10 but we all know that probably won’t happen
Spark3d? I remember that from a while ago, I wanted to use it but I never got time… have the graphics gotten better? Last time I saw it they were moderately outdated, but still pretty good.
And thank you

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a game engine?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

What type of graphics are you planning on using? 3D? 2D? Isometric? Sprite based? 3D Model Based? If it’s 3D, will you be writing your own graphics library, or using OpenGL? (God forbid, DirectX).
I’ve been working on a 3D engine in C#.net, if you’d like to check it out.
http://sourceforge.net/projects/spark3d/
All the code is in the SVN, I haven’t made any releases yet.

Good luck ;\

Read full topic

item.description:
